instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was dropped. Now it shows nothing on the internal screen. On a external monitor it works normally and also recognizes the internal screen. If i look closely i can see that the LCD backlight is activating in the moment as the keyboard backlight turns on (same second the apple logo finishes loading on the external monitor) I can also close it and open it back up and the backlight tuens right back on. I can also turn LCD backlight brightnes up and down manually in the OS. I tried 2 other LCDs (not new ones - i took them a while ago from dead devices but at least one of them should show any reaction i think) and i get the same issue on both. I measured 5.11V on L8300. Now i am stuck.

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: So you have backlight and just a black image? Check diode mode on <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-29 on pin 1.

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: That is fine. Is there continuity from pin 2 of all those caps to the end of a separate LCD cable?

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes it is. It beeps and the reading is always <10 Ohms

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Then there should just be an image. There could be board damage under the CPU still of course. Was the original LCD cracked or just no image after the drop?

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: No it was not cracked. It was just no image...

threads.title: No image on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: My bet is on cracked traces under the CPU then. Just to make sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high? If so then this board is probably not fixable.
